intro: Paronychia subandina, commonly known as the Andean mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and clusters of pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, adapting to harsh, high-altitude conditions. Its compact growth habit and frost resistance make it a hardy species suitable for rock gardens. Paronychia subandina is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in its native habitat.
